peah se lærow dis eall smealice & openlice gecyde, ne forstent
though the teacher this all carefully and openly tells, not avails
it him noht (CP 163.18)
it him naught
Though the teacher tells all this carefully and openly, it avails him nought.
b. peah pe we pas ping cwepe, ne tellad we synne weosan
though that we these things say, not count we sin to be
gesinscipe (Bede 1.18, p. 82)
wedlock
`Though we say these things, we do not count wedlo ck as sin.'

gesinscipe (Bede 1.18, p. 82)
wedlock

peah pe we pas ping cwepe, ne tellad we synne weosan gesinscipe
though that we these things say, not count we sin to be wedlock
Though we say these things, we do not count wedlo ck as sin.

tier.item: c. Gif ponne ge lifes bæd forhycgad, ne magon ge ænige pinga lifes
if then you life's bath despise, not may you in any thing life's
hlaf onfon. (Bede 2.5)
bread receive
`(But) if you despise the bath of life, you may not in any wise receive
the bread of life.'

igt.tag-types: L+CR L+CR G L G L+AC G T T T

tier.item: a. Gif micel feornis siidfætes betweohn liged, pætte bisceopes æpelice
if much distance bishops between lies so that bishops easily
cuman ne magon, hwæder mot biscp halgad beon buton
come not may, whether may bishop consecrated be without
odera biscopa ondweardnesse? (Bede 1.27)
other bishop's presence
`If the distance between bishops is great, so that bishops may not
easily travel, may a bishop be consecrated without the presence of
other bishops?'
a. Gif micel feornis siidfætes betweohn liged, pætte bisceopes æpelice
if much distance bishops between lies so that bishops easily
cuman ne magon, hwæder mot biscp halgad beon buton
come not may, whether may bishop consecrated be without
odera biscopa ondweardnesse? (Bede 1.27)
other bishop's presence
`If the distance between bishops is great, so that bishops may not
easily travel, may a bishop be consecrated without the presence of
other bishops?'
Gif micel feornis siidfætes betweohn liged, pætte bisceopes æpelice
if much distance bishops between lies so that bishops easily
cuman ne magon, hwæder mot biscp halgad beon buton

odera biscopa ondweardnesse?
(Bede 1.27)
other bishop's presence
If the distance between bishops is great, so that bishops may not easily travel, may a bishop be consecrated without the presence of other bishops?

tier.item: b. Gif hwa nu bid mid hwelcum welum geweorpod & mid hwelcum
if who now be with whatever riches endowed and with whatever
deorwyrpum æhtum ne belimpp se
gegyrewod, hu
valuable possessions adorned, whether not belongs the
weorpscipe ponne to pam pe hine geweorpad? (ConsPhil 96.12)
glory then to him that him adorned?
`Now if anyone is endowed with all riches and adorned with all valu-
able possessions, does not the glory then belong to him who adorned
him?'
b. Gif hwa nu bid mid hwelcum welum geweorpod & mid hwelcum

glory then to him that him adorned?

able possessions, does not the glory then belong to him who adorned
him?'

tier.item: c. Gif ponne for micele ´ yrdnesse hwylc mon ne gepyrstgad
arw
if then for much veneration which man not ventures
onfon,
´ se is to herienne. (Bede 1.27)
to receive, he is to praise
`Who ever, out of great veneration, does not venture to receive, then,
is to be praised.'38
